trial_identification.studytitle: The Long Term Effect of Inhaled Hypertonic Saline (6%) in Patients With Non Cystic Fibrosis Bronchiectasis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The Long Term Effect of Inhaled Hypertonic Saline (6%) in Patients With Non-cystic Fibrosis Bronchiectasis.

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Hypertonic saline 6% -
Active Comparator: 1 -
Treatment: drugs: Hypertonic saline 6% - Hypertonic saline (6%) - 5mls twice a day via a nebuliser for 12 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: - St George Respiratory questionnaire - Leicester Cough Questionnaire - Lung Function Tests

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- diagnosis of bronchiectasis on high resolution computer tomography
- at least 2 respiratory exacerbations per year over the past 2 years
- producing sputum daily
- in a stable clinical state
- over 18 years of age.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- cystic fibrosis
- Positive response to hypertonic saline challenge - FEV 1 decreased by = 15%
- FEV 1 = 1L

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the daily inhalation of nebulised hypertonic saline (6%) will decrease the incidence of pulmonary exacerbations and increase the quality of life for people with non cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Elkins MR, Robinson M, Rose BR, Harbour C, Moriarty CP, Marks GB, Belousova EG, Xuan W, Bye PT; National Hypertonic Saline in Cystic Fibrosis (NHSCF) Study Group. A controlled trial of long-term inhaled hypertonic saline in patients with cystic fibrosis. N Engl J Med. 2006 Jan 19;354(3):229-40. Kellett F, Redfern J, Niven RM. Evaluation of nebulised hypertonic saline (7%) as an adjunct to physiotherapy in patients with stable bronchiectasis. Respir Med. 2005 Jan;99(1):27-31.
